issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
TestBlocksWithNotEnoughRacks unit test fails with the following error message:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
testCorruptBlockRereplicatedAcrossRacks(org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.blockmanagement.TestBlocksWithNotEnoughRacks)  Time elapsed: 8997 sec  <<< FAILURE!
org.junit.ComparisonFailure: Corrupt replica expected:<...��^EI�u�[�{���[$�\hF�[�R{O�L^S��g�#�O��׼��Wv��6u4Hd)FaŔ��^W�0��H/�^ZU^@�6�<02>���":)$�{|�^@�-���|GvW��7g �/M��[U!eF�>^N^?�4pR�d��|��Ŵ7j^O^Sh�^@�nu�(�^C^Y�;I�Q�K^O����"c���   oKtE�*�����^\3u��]Ē:mŭ^^y�����^H��_^T�^Z����S����4�7�C�^G�_���\|^W�vo���zgU�lmJ)_vq~�+^Mo^G^O�W}�.�4����        ��6b�S�&G�^?��m4FW#^@����
D5��}�^Z�^]���mfR^G#T-�N��̋�p���`�~��`�^F;�^C]> but was:<...��^EI�u�[�{���[$�\hF�[R{O�L^S��g�#�O��׼��Wv��6u4Hd)FaŔ��^W�0��H/�^ZU^@�6�<02>�":)$�{|�^@�-���|GvW��7g �/M�[U!eF�>^N^?�4pR�d��|��Ŵ7j^O^Sh�^@�nu�(�^C^Y�;I�Q�K^O����"c���      oKtE�*�����^\3u��]Ē:mŭ^^y���^H��_^T�^Z����S���4�7�C�^G�_���\|^W�vo���zgU�lmJ)_vq~�+^Mo^G^O�W}�.�4����   ��6b�S�&G�^?��m4FW#^@����
D5��}�^Z�^]���mfR^G#T-�N�̋�p���`�~��`�^F;�]>
        at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:123)
        at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.blockmanagement.TestBlocksWithNotEnoughRacks.testCorruptBlockRereplicatedAcrossRacks(TestBlocksWithNotEnoughRacks.java:229)

comments.body: The root cause is that the unit test code uses in.read() method to read the block content char by char., which will abandon the LF. So the best way is to use buffer to read the block content.

{color:green}+1 overall{color}.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12577969/HDFS-4681.patch
  against trunk revision .

    {color:green}+1 @author{color}.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    {color:green}+1 tests included{color}.  The patch appears to include 1 new or modified test files.

    {color:green}+1 javac{color}.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    {color:green}+1 javadoc{color}.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    {color:green}+1 eclipse:eclipse{color}.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    {color:green}+1 findbugs{color}.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    {color:green}+1 release audit{color}.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    {color:green}+1 core tests{color}.  The patch passed unit tests in hadoop-hdfs-project/hadoop-hdfs.

    {color:green}+1 contrib tests{color}.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HDFS-Build/4216//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HDFS-Build/4216//console

This message is automatically generated.

It seems like converting random bytes to String is error prone in the first place. I think a better fix would be to add a utility to DFSTestUtil which returns the file as a byte[] instead of a String. Then we don't need to worry about encodings, linefeeds, etc.
Sure, Todd, add a utility to DFSTestUtil which returns byte[]. Change String comparison to byte[] comparison.

any update on when this defect will be included? still breaks in 204 build. thanks
HDFS-3267 already tracks this issue.
Any update on this defect? The target version still points to older version.

This issue is still there in the latest development version..
The patch is not yet applied.
